messages.content: LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy is a ComfyUI custom node that allows inpainting and outpainting using the Latent Consistency Model (LCM).
What is the purpose of the Mix Images feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy?
The Mix Images feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy allows users to blend two images together seamlessly.
How does the FreeU feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy work?
The FreeU feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy allows for more freedom and flexibility in the inpainting and outpainting process, enabling users to have greater control over the final image.
What does the ReferenceOnly feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy do?

The ReferenceOnly feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy allows users to use a reference image to guide the inpainting or outpainting process without directly including the reference image in the final output.
How can users perform style transfer using LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy?
LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy allows users to transfer the style of one image onto another, enabling them to create new artistic compositions.
What is promptless outpainting in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy?
Promptless outpainting in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy enables users to extend an image beyond its original borders without requiring additional textual prompts.
How can users create image variations using LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy?
LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy allows users to generate various image variations based on an initial input image.
What is the Canvas Inpaint/Outpaint/img2img feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy?
The Canvas Inpaint/Outpaint/img2img feature in LCM_Inpaint-Outpaint_Comfy enables users to perform inpainting, outpainting, and image-to-image translation directly on the canvas within ComfyUI.
